jobs.experience: 2 - 4 years

requirements: Bachelor’s degree in medical laboratory science (MLS) or a related field
Registered with Medical Laboratory Science Council of Nigeria

Laboratory techniques
Testing analysis & Basic Quality management
Quantitative research and statistics

responsibilities: Calibrate instruments when required according to the relevant work Instruction / SOP / refer to index.
Prepare and load reagents on the analysers according to the manufacturer’s instructions.
Analyse and process all samples when required according to the relevant work instruction / SOP.
Perform scheduled maintenance on instruments according to the relevant work instructions / SOP.
Receive specimens on the LIS system prior to analysis when required according to the work instruction / SOP.
Enter and verify results manually according to the relevant work instruction / SOP.
Use the analyser batch to process routine results on the instruments which are interfaced according to the relevant work instruction / SOP.
Perform daily 10% checks on manually entered results according to the relevant work instructions / SOP
Prepare agars and other materials needed to ensure smooth operations in the lab
Communicate and document evidence of communication of critical report to the pathologist and/or patients’ physician for swift action.
Periodic equipment maintenance – (daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly etc.)
Maintain a daily diary of events on the bench.
Train, supervise and support junior scientists and technicians bench procedures, troubleshooting and maintenance procedures on each bench according to the relevant work instruction / SOP
Evaluate new equipment and or diagnostic kits according to the relevant requirements as needed in conjunction with the Technical Quality co-ordinator.
Perform, review and trouble shoot internal quality control results.
Document daily QC results and corrective action where required, perform and review IQA, implement improvement plans
Participate in the internal and external quality assurance program of the organisation
Write and review Standard Operating procedures (SOP), work instructions and policies and procedures for accreditation purposes in conjunction with Quality department.
Perform daily administrative tasks such completing quality management forms as requested by the Team lead, and/or Branch operations manager.
Weekly stock consumptions on the inventory manager
Weekly stock monitoring and utilization (zero expiration of stock on ground - first expiry first out)
Monthly STOs and end of month stock report (zero stock out on consumables)
Clear all outstanding reports from the previous day upon resumption of work.

responsibilities: Provide national-level technical leadership and coordination for implementation of Health Systems Strengthening (HSS) strategies embedded within Quality Improvement (QI) programming

Competencies: Teamwork and Co-operation L2

Competencies: Commitment to MSF Principles L2

responsibilities: Supervising, supporting, and evaluating the team under his/her responsibility particularly midwives, midwife assistants and other related staff in her team such as cleaners.
Planning and organizing their work (areas, days, absences, visits, holidays, etc) and coaching them in their work with special focus in following all appropriate protocols and procedures.
Ensuring teamwork and a professional relationship between maternity and other departments.

Supervising the clinical activities in all the maternity departments and activities such as ante-natal consultations, delivery and after delivery follow up, post-natal consultations, family planning consultations, new-born vaccinations and liaising with the Medical Doctor about the patients who need special care times, visiting hours, etc.

Ensuring that the staff on duty knows, implements, and always follows the universal hygiene standards/ precautions, bio-hazard prevention and infection control in the medical premises ensuring high standards of hygiene in the working environment.

Ensuring that all staff using medical devices are qualified and trained, cleaning and minor maintenance tasks are performed according to the protocols, reporting any malfunction to the project biomedical service.
Being responsible for the department-related pharmacy activities (stock and consumption monitoring) as well as maintenance of the medical equipment.

Being responsible for ensuring that all the administrative procedures, patients’ data and documents are filled in correctly and registered for compiling monthly reports reflecting the activity in the department.

In certain contexts, being responsible for ensuring that the maternity staff can identify, receive, and provide care to the victims of the SGBV in collaboration with the Obs & Gyne MD and following the protocols.
Ensure technical overview and mentorship of clinical staff involved in Antenatal Care, Postnatal Care, Family Planning and in the care for survivors of Sexual and Gender Based violence.

Ensure timely, confidential, and survivor-centred care for SV/GBV survivors, including emergency contraception, STI management, HIV PEP, wound care, and pregnancy-related services, in line with national protocols and MSF guidelines.
The provision of capacity building, theoretical and bedside training, for technical skills, patient centred care, infection prevention and control (IPC).
Participation in the community engagement to promote, support community actors to understand package of care and help create a safe pathway for target population.
And promote confidentiality and privacy in all aspects of survivor care, including documentation and referral processes.
Strengthen and maintain safe referral pathways between the community, PHC and further case management, psychosocial support, and emergency services.
Ensure accurate, confidential, and ethical documentation of clinical services, in line with data protection standards.

Planning and organizing their work (areas, days, absences, visits, holidays, etc) and coaching them in their work with special focus in following all appropriate protocols and procedures.
Ensuring teamwork and a professional relationship between maternity and other departments.

Supervising the clinical activities in all the maternity departments and activities such as ante-natal consultations, delivery and after delivery follow up, post-natal consultations, family planning consultations, new-born vaccinations and liaising with the Medical Doctor about the patients who need special care times, visiting hours, etc.

Ensuring that the staff on duty knows, implements, and always follows the universal hygiene standards/precautions, bio-hazard prevention and infection control in the medical premises ensuring high standards of hygiene in the working environment.

Ensuring that all staff using medical devices are qualified and trained, cleaning and minor maintenance tasks are performed according to the protocols, reporting any malfunction to the project biomedical service.
Being responsible for the department-related pharmacy activities (stock and consumption monitoring) as well as maintenance of the medical equipment.

Being responsible for ensuring that all the administrative procedures, patients’ data and documents are filled in correctly and registered for compiling monthly reports reflecting the activity in the department.
how_to_apply: Click here to apply online: https://medicalworldnigeria.com/post/Midwife-Supervisor-Fixed-Term-at-Medecins-Sans-Frontieres-MSF-Belgium?pid=77066
Submit an application including cover letter, resume, and a copy of relevant certificates and NYSC certificate/Exemption letters.

responsibilities: Draft technical specifications, SOWs, and terms of reference (TORs) for goods and services.

Support negotiation of technical terms (not financial) and review draft agreements for accuracy.
Ensure programmatic approvals and collaborate with CMS for financial approvals and execution.
Monitor subcontract deliverables, verify completion, and report discrepancies.
Track subcontract performance and maintain documentation for audits.
Provides support to project management, delivers presentations, and leads meetings.
Reviews expense reports and invoices prior to management approval.
Reviews purchase orders in the finance system of record (headquarters' (HQ) only).

requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Medical Laboratory Science.

responsibilities: Perform routine and specialized laboratory tests in areas such as hematology, clinical chemistry, microbiology, immunology, serology, and transfusion services.

Maintain confidentiality and comply with patient data protection regulations.
Follow established biosafety and infection control practices.
Handle and dispose of hazardous materials safely and responsibly.
Ensure compliance with all applicable laboratory and health regulations.
Collaborate with healthcare providers and interdisciplinary teams to support optimal patient care.
Engage in continuing education to stay current with advances in laboratory science and technology.
